summary: The text discusses the symbolic significance of the Ark of the Covenant, which was believed to bring victory to the people of God. Moses understood it as a representation of Christ, containing 'all treasures of wisdom and knowledge' similar to how the ark contained the tablets of the covenant. David, interpreting this as a song about Christ's exaltation, quotes Moses to signify Christ's resurrection and the dispersion of his enemies. The text indicates that enemies who persist in hatred toward Christ will be removed from His presence, reflecting the ultimate punishment of being separated from God's glory. The punishment is intensified by likening the fate of sinners to smoke evaporating or wax melting away in the presence of fire, emphasizing their separation from true being, which is God.
